alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:18AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Several days of heavy rainfall in western Hot Springs County has caused flows to increase on Owl Creek. Additionally, releases from Anchor Dam will be increased today to mitigate concerns in that area. Flows in Owl Creek are expected to be bankfull and higher to cause minor flooding concerns from Anchor Dam down to the Bighorn River. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall and increased dam releases is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past couple of days. This has caused small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in Owl Creek from Anchor Dam to the Bighorn River. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past couple of days. - Owl Creek from Anchor Dam to the Bighorn River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
